member.name: Rect.Clone
member.summary: The Rect.Clone method creates a newRect object and initializes it with the contents of this Rect object.
member.returns: This method returns a pointer to the newRect object.

member.name: Rect.Contains
member.summary: The Rect.Contains method determines whether a point is inside this rectangle.
member.param: Reference to a point to be tested.
member.returns: If the point is inside the rectangle, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: Rect.Equals
member.summary: The Rect.Equals method determines whether two rectangles are the same.
member.param: Reference to a rectangle to compare to this rectangle.
member.returns: If the rectangles are the same, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: Rect.GetBottom
member.summary: The Rect.GetBottom method gets the y-coordinate of the bottom edge of the rectangle.
member.returns: This method returns the y-coordinate of the bottom edge of the rectangle.

member.name: Rect.GetBounds
member.summary: The Rect.GetBounds method makes a copy of this rectangle.
member.param: Pointer to aRect object that receives the copy of this rectangle.

member.name: Rect.GetLeft
member.summary: The Rect.GetLeft method gets the x-coordinate of the left edge of the rectangle.
member.returns: This method returns the x-coordinate of the left edge of the rectangle.

member.name: Rect.GetLocation
member.summary: The Rect.GetLocation method gets the coordinates of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
member.param: Pointer to a Point object that receives the coordinates of the upper-left corner.

member.name: Rect.GetRight
member.summary: The Rect.GetRight method gets the x-coordinate of the right edge of the rectangle.
member.returns: This method returns the x-coordinate of the right edge of the rectangle.

member.name: Rect.GetSize
member.summary: The Rect.GetSize method gets the width and height of the rectangle.
member.param: Pointer to a Size object that receives the width and height of the rectangle.

member.name: Rect.GetTop
member.summary: The Rect.GetTop method gets the y-coordinate of the top edge of the rectangle.
member.returns: This method returns the y-coordinate of the top edge of the rectangle.

member.name: Rect.Inflate
member.summary: The Rect.Inflate method expands the rectangle by the value of point.X on the left and right edges, and by the value ofpoint.Y on the top and bottom edges.
member.param: Reference to a Point object whoseX data member specifies the amount to expand the rectangle on the left and right edges, and whoseY data member specifies the amount to expand the rectangle on the top and bottom edges.

member.name: Rect.Intersect
member.summary: The Rect.Intersect method determines the intersection of two rectangles and stores the result in aRect object.
member.param: Reference to aRect object that receives the intersection of the two rectangles.
Reference to one of the two rectangles to be intersected.
Reference to one of the two rectangles to be intersected.
member.returns: If the intersection of the two rectangles is not empty, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: Rect.IntersectsWith
member.summary: The Rect.IntersectsWith method determines whether this rectangle intersects another rectangle.
member.param: Reference to a rectangle to test.
member.returns: If the intersection of the two rectangles is not empty, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: Rect.IsEmptyArea
member.summary: The Rect.IsEmptyArea method determines whether this rectangle is empty.
member.returns: If the rectangle is empty, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: Rect.Offset
member.summary: The Rect.Offset method moves the rectangle bydx horizontally and bydy vertically.
member.param: Integer that specifies the amount to move the rectangle horizontally.
Integer that specifies the amount to move the rectangle vertically.

member.name: Rect.Rect
member.summary: Creates a Rect object by using a Point object to initialize theX andY data members and a Size object to initialize theWidth andHeight data members.
member.param: Reference to a Point object that specifies the upper-left corner of this rectangle.
Reference to a Size object that specifies the width and height of this rectangle.

member.name: Rect.Rect
member.summary: Creates a Rect object by using four integers to initialize theX,Y,Width, andHeight data members.
member.param: Integer used to initialize the x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
Integer used to initialize the y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
Integer used to initialize the width of this rectangle.
Integer used to initialize the height of this rectangle.

member.name: Rect.Rect
member.summary: Creates a Rect object whose x-coordinate, y-coordinate, width, and height are all zero. This is the default constructor.

member.name: Rect.Union
member.summary: The Rect.Union method determines the union of two rectangles and stores the result in aRect object.
member.param: Reference to aRect object that receives the union of the two rectangles.
Reference to one of the two rectangles used to form the union.
Reference to one of the two rectangles used to form the union.
member.returns: If the union of two rectangles is not empty, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.
